abstract: Investigators are still seeking cause of explosion that caused manhole cover to fly into air and strike pedestrian in Park Slope, Brooklyn; incident is extreme example of manhole-related accidents, including fires, that plague New York City in winter.
lead_paragraph: It is rare for a manhole cover, which can weigh as much as 300 pounds, to erupt into the air, and rarer still for it to strike someone in the head, as one in Park Slope, Brooklyn, did this week.

headline.main: When Part of the Streetscape Turns Into a Flying Danger
headline.print_headline: When Part of the Streetscape Turns Into a Flying Danger
headline.seo: Man Is Struck in the Head by a Manhole Cover in Brooklyn

snippet: It is rare for a manhole cover, which can weigh as much as 300 pounds, to erupt into the air, and rarer still for it to strike someone in the head, as one in Park Slope, Brooklyn, did this week.
